title.native: 痛いのは嫌なので防御力に極振りしたいと思います。2
title.romaji: Itai no wa Iya nano de Bougyoryoku ni Kyokufuri Shitai to Omoimasu. 2
title.english: BOFURI: I Don't Want to Get Hurt, so I'll Max Out My Defense. Season 2

description:
The second season of Itai no wa Iya nano de Bougyoryoku ni Kyokufuri Shitai to Omoimasu.

The best offense is a great defense, and for VRMMO gamer Kaede Honjo, her defense is the best. Under her alias Maple, she and her guild journey through NewWorld Online gaining friends and foes through new battle-filled quests. All those skill points, new defensive techniques, and no pain—Maple can’t be stopped!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Episode 1 was streamed in advance on December 17, 2022 on the KADOKAWA Anime YouTube Channel. The regular TV broadcast began on January 11, 2023.
synonyms: น้องโล่สายแทงก์แกร่งเกินร้อย ภาค 2
Aku Tidak Ingin Terluka Jadi Seluruh Poin Status Kufokuskan ke Pertahanan 2
Бофури. Я боюсь боли, так что качаю только защиту 2

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Tentacles
tags.description: Features the long appendages most commonly associated with octopuses or squid, often sexually penetrating a character.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [special effects artist](https://anilist.co/staff/197122/)._

An art director affiliated with Studio Tulip.

_Note: Not to be confused with [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/103341/)._
